) This section describes the policies and procedures governing information nology services throughout the Office of Chief Counsel. Technology (

) The Chief Counsel Modernization and Vision Strategy Executive Steering Committee (CC ESC) was established to meet the IRS and Office of Modernization and ment and Budget (OMB) governance requirements for the Counsel Strategy System Environment (CASE). Steering (

) The CC ESC is chartered by the Modernization and Information Technology Services Enterprise Governance (MEG) Committee and governs projects the CC portfolio. a. The CC ESC charter is approved by the MEG Committee Co-Chairs. Program Governance Office is responsible for maintaining and updating the charter as necessary. b. The CC ESC is responsible for establishing operating protocols with the charter. (

) The primary objective of the CC ESC is to ensure project objectives are met, risks are managed appropriately, and the expenditure of enterprise’s is fiscally sound. The CC ESC provides governance for all Major and Non- Major CC projects. For the Non-Major projects, governance is on an basis — either the project is deemed as high visibility or the project has exceeded defined variance thresholds. Governance includes, but is not to, the following: (cid:

b. It is the responsibility of the voting member to notify the co-chairs if a proxy will be in attendance. Proxies have full participatory rights and empowered to vote on behalf of the absent member. The CC ESC replaced the former Information Management Policy Board (IMPB).

Management (

) Each Chief Counsel office is responsible for providing information and sions for its individual page(s) on the Chief Counsel (CC) Intranet. Each Intranet Counsel office will designate an individual to review the information on its page(s) of the CC Intranet to ensure correctness and continued least once every month. (

) The Associate Chief Counsel (F&M) has overall responsibility for the CC Intranet, with final decision authority over its content and style. The Chief Counsel (F&M) provides guidance and coordination to each Chief Counsel Office on CC Intranet issues as needed. (
) The actual operation and maintenance of the CC Intranet is assigned to Technical Support Branch of the Counsel Information System Office (
) As of October

) “Broadcast/All User” e-mail messages should receive pre-authorization in headquarters office by an Associate Chief Counsel. In field offices, “All messages should be approved by the Area Counsel; cross-functional messages should be approved by the F&M Area Manager. “All User” messages should include the name and title of the authorizing official. (

, Labor and Employee Relations. Use of IT (

) This subsection establishes policy and procedures for streaming media in office of Chief Counsel. These policies and procedures are meant to Media in the the resources available to both developers and consumers of streaming Chief Counsel while at the same time minimizing the impact on other Chief Counsel traffic. (
) Streaming media are efficient and economical methods for Office nationwide to access live (synchronous) or archived (asynchronous or on- demand) information from a single source. (

) The primary purposes of streaming media are training and associated with the mission of the Office of Chief Counsel. Counsel’s goal provide content that is meaningful, relevant, and timely, and which helps employees perform their jobs to their maximum potential.
The actual operation and maintenance of the CC Intranet is assigned to the Technical Support Branch of the Counsel Information System Office (CISO).

) This subsection establishes policy and procedures for streaming media in the office of Chief Counsel. These policies and procedures are meant to maximize the resources available to both developers and consumers of streaming media while at the same time minimizing the impact on other Chief Counsel network traffic. (
) Streaming media are efficient and economical methods for Office employees nationwide to access live (synchronous) or archived (asynchronous or on- demand) information from a single source. (

) The primary purposes of streaming media are training and communications associated with the mission of the Office of Chief Counsel. Counsel’s goal is provide content that is meaningful, relevant, and timely, and which helps employees perform their jobs to their maximum potential.
streaming media available requires cooperation among content the Chief Counsel intranet Webmaster, and IT Operations.
) Materials — Effort should be made by the content owner to provide Powe
oint files, or other materials utilized in the video to viewers Materials links in the Media Player. (

) Lifespan — Effort should be made by the content owner to identify the lifespan of each piece of streaming content. This ensures that all content is timely and relevant. In addition, it will facilitate maintenance of launch page(s) and keep server storage space available for newer (

) Audience — It may be possible to limit access to streaming content to more appropriate audiences. If this is necessary, it will be the the content owner to provide this information to the Office of Training and Communications on submission of the streaming content. (
) The Office of Training and Communications will be responsible for streaming files in accordance with parameters set by the Streaming and Control Board. (

) The Webmaster will be responsible for: a. Any additional coding or repackaging of those streaming files to network protocols or standards b. Modifying the web page(s) used to launch the streaming files c. Limiting access to content based on audience specifications from the content owner or The Office of Training and Communications d. Removing links and/or content at the end of their lifespan (
) IT Operations will be responsible for: a. Positioning necessary files on appropriate server(s) b. Archiving streaming files in accordance with the usual standards for backup and archiving

Lifespan — Effort should be made by the content owner to identify the lifespan of each piece of streaming content. This ensures that all available content is timely and relevant. In addition, it will facilitate maintenance of the launch page(s) and keep server storage space available for newer content.

Audience — It may be possible to limit access to streaming content to one or more appropriate audiences. If this is necessary, it will be the responsibility of the content owner to provide this information to the Office of Training and Communications on submission of the streaming content.
The Office of Training and Communications will be responsible for producing streaming files in accordance with parameters set by the Streaming Media
